thread.title: Spurs fall in Aldridge’s debut

author: Jeff McDonald
title: Spurs fall in Aldridge’s debut
text:

Photo: Rich Pedroncelli, Associated Press Sacramento Kings center DeMarcus Cousins, left, protects the ball... Spurs fall in Aldridge’s debut 1 / 6 Back to Gallery SACRAMENTO, Calif. – LaMarcus Aldridge tugged at his brand new No. 12 black and silver jersey Thursday, leaned over the scorer’s table and smiled.
“It’s weird,” Aldridge said. “It’s very weird.”
Aldridge’s new basketball home, it turns out, will take some getting used to.
In his first game with his new team, Aldridge scored eight points on 3-for-10 shooting as the Spurs lost their preseason opener 95-92 to Sacramento at Sleep Train Arena.
With Tim Duncan, Tony Parker, Manu Ginobili, Boris Diaw and coach Gregg Popovich all remaining in San Antonio, the Spurs showed only a fraction of the roster Kings coach George Karl said might be the best in the NBA.
Kawhi Leonard led the Spurs with 16 points, with Kyle Anderson chipping in 15.
Rudy Gay finished with 26 points for the Kings, who were playing its third preseason game in four nights.
